sub_title: Change leader | (Digital) Strategy | Continuous improvement | Innovation | Sustainability & Social Capital
summary:
As a change-driven and passionate professional, it is my absolute goal to link strategy, sustainability and innovation with transformation. 

With a proven record of driving change programs for improving business results, I am driven to lead major transformations in multinational organizations and navigate them in environments where innovation and execution go hand in hand. I find it exciting to harmonize IQ and EQ in order to achieve the best solution. With my empathy, decisiveness and strong communication skills, I ensure that we discover and utilize unique opportunities in various businesses and international markets.

Resistance during change is a given because “transformation always hurts a little”. I find it a rewarding task to guide and equip employees and managers in how they can deal effectively with change, business challenges and performance. I strive to inspire and encourage them to think outside the box and perform meaningful work. In this way, I like to contribute to the development of the organization, but also to the learning process of others. Change can be an intense process. However, if you do this carefully without losing sight of the human aspect, this creates room for beautiful opportunities that can take the organization to an even higher level.

profile_positions.description:
The Enterprise Informatics Business aims to change the industry by focusing on servant technology that addresses our users’ challenges and helps us care even better for care givers. The Enterprise Informatics Business unlocks the access and insights from combined imaging and monitoring data pools at scale to improve workflows, enhance caregiver and patient experience, and elevate care delivery. The Enterprise Informatics Processes and Tool Excellence (PSE) Team designs capabilities and builds an agile intuitive operational backbone to enable organizational excellence.
I am the trusted business partner for leaders and teams to drive performance improvements with direct impact on the business results and deliver operational excellence to our customers. And for the PSE team, I am the chief of staff.

Responsibilities:
• Deploying the Business Transformation strategy, including selection of target areas, priority setting and decision making and acceleration of effective execution.
• Orchestrating and owning projects with significant cross business impact with global implications applying Lean, CI, Agile, Design Thinking, project and change management practices.
• Leading strategic plans to achieve business goals and sustainable behavioral changes to ensure a long-term competitive advantage while driving operational excellence.
• Defining and executing on the operating model of the PSE Team together with the PSE Leader, while managing complexity across multiple areas  
• Constantly challenging the status quo, being a part of creating a ground-breaking vision for meaningful long-term success.
profile_positions.title: Business Excellence Leader Informatics

profile_positions.description:
The Connected Care businesses help broaden the reach and deepen the impact of healthcare with solutions that leverage and unite devices, informatics, data and people across networks of care to enable our customers to deliver on the mission. I am the trusted business partner for the senior leaders and enable them to accelerate the transformation journey with their teams in a constructive manner by challenging the status quo, coaching teams and applying the Philips Excellence principles and tools.

Responsibilities:
• Embedding transformation capabilities in the businesses, markets and functions across Connected Care. 
• Leading the Philips Business System deployment and embedding in the business (Innovation, Marketing, Operations) harmonizing effort, impact and way of working in execution and innovation.
• Bringing transparency around all business transformation initiatives and work with the central teams to set the right priorities and sequence based on the business objectives and critical metrics.
• Providing thought leadership and strategic direction on how the business can execute and deploy the key corporate strategic transformation initiatives and implement Philips Excellence.
• Partnering with the leadership team to drive customer driven innovation and accelerate digitalization & platformization.
profile_positions.title: Business Transformation Manager Connected Care
Chair of the Board of Advisors
Member Of The Board Of Advisors

profile_positions.description:
SparQ is a web based application and the first customer driven, end-to-end RegTech platform that empowers organizations to comply with the increasing regulatory pressure.  
SparQ started as an innovation initiative in the ING Innovation Lab matured into a MVP ready for production, scaling up and spin-in back to the business (Corporate Compliance & Legal). As part of this spin-in, all operations and support activities need to be identified and embedded in the standing organization. 

Responsibilities as operations manager and product owner:
• Defining and implementing the target operating model for SparQ as spin-in software solution including the set-up and management of the squad
• Implementing and embedding SparQ in regulatory document creation within ING as new global standard in the way of working across relevant departments and/or areas
• Running SparQ within ING: Service management, operations, user, risk and stakeholder management
• Contributing to SparQ product improvements, experiments, testing, releases and changes to increase efficiency, effectiveness and user experience based on trends and new user requirements
• Providing first line user support to all stakeholders and users of SparQ within ING (i.e. training, demonstrations, tool adoption, user group/community management, online and offline support etc.)
profile_positions.title: Operations manager & Product Owner RegTech platform (scale-up)

profile_positions.description:
The Global HR People Services department provides people services across ING and manages the relationship with the shared service centers with a strong focus on the employee experience. I am responsible for process engineering, RPA, AI and innovative digital solutions to support the end-to-end HR services across countries, Communities of Expertise and the supplier.

Responsibilities: 
• Setting up the HR BPO management department, defining and implementing the design principles and operating model for service management and continuous improvement 
• Managing and improving the global service delivery of HR operations and processes with internal and external suppliers 
• Defining and providing digital HR service enabling technologies and solutions on one seamless platform to improve employee experience 
• Designing and implementing the employee experience framework, a service mind-set and digital capabilities (e.g. employee platform, service enabling technologies, onboarding application)
• Leading innovation projects on Robotic Process Automation and a Virtual Assistant 
• Creating a disruptive change in employee experience during onboarding in the innovation lab using the Design Thinking, Lean start-up and agile methodologies and tools
profile_positions.title: Managing consultant People Services

profile_positions.description:
Working towards a Model Bank, with one retail strategy and a harmonised retail proposition, fully focused on increasing customer interaction. Aimed at further customer and volume growth, we will deliver a scalable business platform, initially for Spain, Italy, France, Czech Republic and Austria. The platform can be extended to additional countries, products and services. An agile, central IT services centre will develop, maintain and run all needed digital requirements.

Responsibilities: 
• Driving feature and process management, creating the target Operational model for Retail Bank Operations
• Designing the retail operations operating model for various countries to operate from one platform
• Defining the operational capabilities needed to deliver the services according with business objective, customer experience and risk appetite
• Engineering lean core retail banking processes and continuous improvement principles
• Consulting on possibilities and features offered by the technical platform, individuate the gaps and measure impact
• Building of centralized capabilities where sourcing opportunities are emerging support: process engineering from a shared services perspective
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant Operations

profile_positions.description:
Consultant on sourcing initiatives for the COO domain of ING Challengers & Growth markets 
Responsible for Retail Banking process and operation migrations to the shared service centers 
Building sourcing capabilities on local and global level for a retail hub
Standardization and harmonization across Retail Banking operations through optimization projects in the shared service center.

Responsibilities: 
• Consulting (black belt) on sourcing initiatives 
• Setting the vision, strategy and set up of the Retail shared service center 
• Leading international Retail Banking process and operation migrations to the ING shared service centers 
• Building of centralized capabilities where sourcing opportunities are a main lever
• Leading multiple operational excellence and lean projects i.e. retail operations sourcing selection framework, workflow tooling, lean service management implementation and process optimization 
• Special assignments: Co-create the Retail Banking operations operating model for various countries
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager Sourcing

profile_positions.description:
European Work Council and Operations & IT Work Council member 

Started as an extra member (buitenlid).
The works council is one of the most important entities of our company. It represents ING's rank and file (staff) by handling Request for Advises, Information Memo's and Endorsement Requests. This is done through continuous dialogue with the directors and higher management of ING.
profile_positions.title: Work council member

profile_positions.description:
Business Manager to the Chief Information Officer (CIO) of ING Commercial Banking.

Responsibilities: 
• Strategic support and advising role towards the CIO CB and the management team in day-to-day activities
• Contributing to and coordination of the delivery of the MTP, financial dynamic planning
• Building bridges and collaboration initiatives with other ING business units
• Special assignments: Banker's oath, IT Stability & Reliability (Global IT processes), IT target operating model
profile_positions.title: Business Manager to CIO

profile_positions.description:
ING Operational and IT Banking (OIB) Chief Administration Office 

Strategy Optimization: Co-creation of the ING IT strategy & metrics 2014-2016 with CIO's, provide advice about the IT change Portfolio and setting up the ING IT Strategy Office. 

Portfolio Management: Focusing on the support of the OIB Management in finding the optimal way to realize the OIB strategy from an independent position. This is done by providing analysis and advices on business cases, priorities, dependencies and scenarios by a team of consultants.
profile_positions.title: Consultant IT Strategy & Change

profile_positions.description:
ING Operations and IT Banking Transformation Programme (TP)

Portfolio office: Co-managing the change portfolio (€100 mio / year) in OIB TP NL & BE and responsible for strategic planning of discretionary project portfolio.

Application office (Apps Office): Focusing on tracking, analysing, advising the execution and steering so the envisioned capabilities will be realized and the IT Health can be guaranteed.
profile_positions.title: Planning Officer / Business support

profile_positions.description:
Contract administrator tracking retirement value transfers. 

Responsibilities: 
• Administrator of retirement transfers between Nationale-Nederlanden and other Insurance companies
• Providing customer service for/with insurance agencies, insurance companies and individual customers
• Main administrative activity is  to sending out letters of recall and customer interaction
profile_positions.title: Contract Administrator

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Servicepunt Emancipatie (SPE) is the knowledge hub for emancipation organizations in Amsterdam. They support the network of women's organizations and other that are empowering women and girls in Amsterdam through various projects.

Every year, they allocate budget (€20.000) to the organizations that will carry out a project around the theme “Self-conscious growing up”, based upon the evaluation of judges. Together with two other judges, I reviewed and voted for the best projects in order for them to carry out the projects to be funded by SPE.
Mentoring a female high school student

ING Operations & IT organizes a benefit dinner for charity "Chances for Children" every year together with Unicef and the IT suppliers. All can participate in an auction to raise money for a special UNICEF project.
Volunteers organise the dinner, support the kitchen and the auction itself.

Facilitated a workshop for women living in Amsterdam Zuidoost on their passion, ambition and success

https://issuu.com/movement1537/docs/zuidoost-13-21_internet/8
